title: Christopher Rouse, classical composer who incorporated elements of rock, notably Led Zeppelin, into his work – obituary
text:
Christopher Rouse, who has died aged 70, was an American composer whose vibrant, frenetic and prolific output incorporated influences from Shostakovich and Bruckner with elements of rock music, particularly that of Led Zeppelin.

His work was championed by some of the biggest names in classical music including Leonard Slatkin, who conducted the premiere of Rouse’s Pulitzer Prize-winning Trombone Concerto, a tribute to the conductor Leonard Bernstein, and Yo-Yo Ma, who gave the premiere in 1994 of Rouse’s Cello Concerto with the Los Angeles Philharmonic.
